sources.title: The Witch's Mirror (1962)
sources.description: The Witch's Mirror (original title: El Espejo de la Bruja ), released in 1962 , is a Mexican horror film directed by Fernando MÃ©ndez . This film is notable for its engaging blend of horror and witchcraft themes, encapsulated in a storyline that involves magic, revenge, and the supernatural. The story revolves around a woman who, betrayed by her unfaithful husband, uses witchcraft and a mystical mirror to exact revenge against him and his lover. As the narrative unfolds, the mirror reveals the past and present, showcasing the dark consequences of vengeance.

metadata.Plot: A husband murders his wife, and years later her ghost emerges from a witch's mirror to take her revenge.
metadata.Actors: Rosita Arenas, Armando Calvo, Isabela Corona
